text: Christian Lloyd (born 24 January 1992) is a New Zealand rugby union player who currently plays as a lock for in the ITM Cup and the in Super Rugby. ==Career== Lloyd was dogged with injury problems throughout the early part of his career and indeed was forced to take a 2-year sabbatical from the game to fully recover. He returned to play 4 games for the Wellington Lions during their ill-fated 2014 ITM Cup campaign which ended in their relegation to the Championship Division. Despite this, Lloyd was identified as a player of huge potential by the Hurricanes and was named in their squad for the 2015 Super Rugby season. ==International career== Lloyd was a member of the New Zealand Under-20 team that competed in the 2012 IRB Junior World Championship in South Africa. ==References== Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:New Zealand rugby union players Category:Rugby union locks Category:Wellington rugby union players Category:Sportspeople from Poole Category:English emigrants to New Zealand Category:People educated at St. Patrick's College, Silverstream Category:Victoria University of Wellington alumni
